Capitol Vista Land Disposition Agreement
data.Details: The Capitol Vista Land Disposition Agreement was executed, which will put forth building 100 units of affordable housing.

data.Topic: Eastern Branch Boys and Girls Club OurRFP second public meeting held
data.Details: More than 40 residents dedicated part of their Saturday to provide DMPED, the Office of Planning and Councilmember Charles Allen (Ward 6) with their input on the future of the former site of the Eastern Branch Boys and Girls Club at 261 17th St SE.

data.Topic: New nonstop flights from New Delhi
data.Details: The District joined Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe and the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority to announce nonstop service between Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL) and Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD). The new air route, which will offer three nonstop, roundtrip flights per week, is estimated to bring $10 million to the District in total economic impact and $30 million annually to the region. Beginning July 4, 2017, Air India will provide nonstop service from DEL to IAD three times weekly.

data.Topic: Economic Intelligence Roundtable - International Business
data.Details: Hosted with the DC Chamber and KPMG.

data.Topic: Eastern Branch Boys and Girls Club OurRFP first public meeting held
Franklin School development team selected
data.Details: Philanthropist Ann B. Friedman and Dantes Partners will transform the historic Franklin School into Planet Word, an interactive language arts museum and education space. Along with the Mundolingua in Paris, Planet Word will be one of just a few fully-operational language museums globally. The museum plans to open its doors to the public by winter 2019.

data.Topic: Washington Auto Show mobility panel
data.Details: The Deputy Mayor spoke at the Washington Auto Show on how DC is taking the lead on autonomous vehicles.

data.Topic: DMPED Cluster Open House
data.Details: Over 500 residents and stakeholders attended DMPED's first-ever open house at the Convention Center. Staff from economic development cluster agencies provided information for and answered questions from attendees.

data.Topic: DMPED attends Consumer Electronic Showcase
data.Details: Promoted DC, including the fact that we are the first U.S. city to have Food Bots thanks to Starship.

data.Topic: Fort Totten Surplus and disposition
data.Details: The DC Council held the final vote approving the surplus and disposition for Fort Totten on Dec. 20. The project will feature affordable homeownership opportunities in a growing area

data.Topic: Bruce Monroe surplus and disposition approved
data.Details: The DC Council held the final vote approving the surplus and disposition of Bruce Monroe on Dec. 20. The project will include 400 affordable housing units, some of which are replacement for Park Morton New Community, and a park.

data.Topic: Capitol Vista Surplus and disposition
data.Details: The DC Council held the final vote approving the surplus and disposition of Capitol Vista on Dec. 20. The project will include 100 affordable housing units.

data.Details: The development will bring to life a long-vacant parcel at MLK Gateway and will include a new tech incubator, long-awaited retail and amenities.

data.Topic: McMillan Sand Filtration Site Goundbreaking
data.Details: "Sandbreaking" at the 25-acre development located at North Capitol Street and Michigan Avenue, NW in Ward 5. The transformative project is expected to create 6,200 jobs and 134 units of affordable housing and produce $1.2 billion in economic activity over 30 years

data.Topic: Affordable Housing Preservation Strike Force Report released
data.Details: Mayor Bowser, Deputy Mayor Kenner, and Polly Donaldson held a press conference &#x2713terday to unveil the plan on how to preserve housing in DC, including preserving all currently subsidized rentals in the District.

data.Topic: Parcel 42 development team selected
data.Details: After an ourRFP process, DMPED selected Parcel 42 Partners out of six proposals to develop Parcel 42. The proposal meets housing, retail, and design preferences of the neighborhood. including 118 large residential units  offering deeper affordability levels than required by law.

data.Topic: Crummell School development team selected
data.Details: DMPED, after completing its ourRFP process, selected Ivy City Partners out of three proposals for the redevelopment Crummell School, a 108,000 square feet site that includes the historic school in the Ivy City neighborhood of Ward 5.

data.Topic: Walter Reed Campus transfer from Federal Governent
data.Details: Mayor Muriel Bowser was joined by Congresswoman Eleanor Holmes Norton, Ward 4 Councilmember Brandon Todd, Assistant Secretary of the Army Katherine Hammack, and Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development Brian Kenner for a ceremony recognizing the transfer of the Walter Reed Campus to the District Government

data.Topic: Doing Business Guide released
data.Details: DMPED, in partnership with the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs, DC Health Link, the Department of Insurance Securities & Banking supported WDCEP's release of the 2016/2017 DC Doing Business Guide publication.

Institute of World Politics Revenue Bond closing
data.Details: $8,500,000 in bonds for the building acquisition.

data.Topic: DC International School moves forward on Walter Reed campus
data.Details: DMPED worked with the DC International School and the US Army to allow the school immediate access to Walter Reed campus to build out the facility in time for the 2017 school year. The renovation will be for the historic 130,000 sf Delano Hall, including the addition of a new gym, auditorium and student commons area. The school expects to open for the 2017 school year and will eventually accommodate 1,500 students from DCI and the Latin American Montessori Bilingual School (LAMB)

data.Topic: Deanwood Hills groundbreaking - Offsite Lincoln Heights New Communities housing
data.Details: The project will produce 150 affordable housing units, including replacement units for  the Lincoln Heights New Community.

data.Topic: Skyland Town TIF legislation to move project forward.
data.Details: DMPED renegotiated the Tax Increment Financing package to allow the project to move forward after the anchor tenant unexpectedly pulled out of the project.

data.Topic: Economic Intelligence Roundtable on Inclusive Growth Metrics
data.Details: As a part of the Economic Strategy work, and in conjunction with the Urban Institute, DMPED held a roundtable to discuss how best to measure and track economic growth and how it is distributed.

data.Topic: Charming Beijing Photo Exhibition
data.Details: The three day exhibition was held at Union Stations main terminal. It celebrated the 2016 China-U.S. Tourism Year and DCs 32-year sister city relationship with Beijing.

data.Topic: C&O Canal revitalization funding
data.Details: The C&O Canal grant will be leveraged with matching federal and private funding to restore and revitalize the one-mile section of the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal National Historical Park and include the purchase of a replica Canal Boat.

data.Topic: Global Trilateral MBA  program with Howard University hosts students from China and South Africa.
data.Details: DMPED supported Howard University's pilot of the Global Trilateral MBA (GTMBA) program. The GTMBA partnered Howard University MBA students with their counterparts in universities from our sister cities Beijing, China and Pretoria, South Africa. The first cohort of students have already travelled to the Central University of Finance and Economics and University of Pretoria earlier this year, and they are now accepting applications for their second cohort. Howard University will now host the 28 students on their campus in early November to study and offer consultative services to DC businesses

data.Topic: Work It! Studio reopens after receiving Great Streets funding.
data.Details: Wanda Bamberg Tia, owner/founder of the Work It! Studio, recipient of a Great Streets grant welcomed back her devoted class members and the public into her newly renovated space at 1020 U Street NW

data.Topic: Economic Strategy Kickoff
data.Details: Public, private, and nonprofit leaders convened to learn about the Economic Strategy process and provide input.

data.Topic: 901 H Street groundbreaking
data.Details: Mayor Bowser participated in the demolition of the H Street Connection strip shopping center to make way for the construction of 901 H Street, 420 residential units over 44,000 feet of ground floor retail.

data.Topic: DMPED works with DISB to provide private fund advisors regulatory relief
data.Details: The change will reduce regulations and relieve smaller investment funds from DISBs registration requirements. This will unleash additional capital into the market to support DC businesses and grow DC jobs.

data.Topic: IDEA Public Charter School Revenue Bon closing
data.Details: $7 million in revenue bonds.

data.Topic: Grant and Revenue Bonds for Busboys and Poets and Far Southeast Family Support Collaborative on MLK Ave
data.Details: The $11 million in IRB bonds and  a grant will be used to rehabilitate an office building on MLK Ave for their permanent headquarters and to bring new and improved services to historic Anacostia and Ward 8 including Busboys and Poets Restaurant

data.Topic: Plaza West affordable housing project groundbreaking
data.Details: This project will not only create over 200 affordable housing units, but will include 50 housing units for grandfamilies, grandparents raising grandchildren.

Leading Age Revenue Bond closing
data.Details: $11 million in revenue bonds. The mission of Leading Age is to expand the world of possibilities for aging through education, advocacy, and applied research. With 6,000+ members and partners include not-for-profit organizations representing the entire field of aging services, 38 state partners, hundreds of businesses, consumer groups, foundations and research partners
